availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Manerva Dougherty Jordan on May 22, 1850. Father of William D. Jordan, Bell Jordan, Malinda Jordan, John Jordan, and Louis Jordan.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 456. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 2, p. 53. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Poplar Plains, p. 18. Fleming County, Kentucky, Marriage Index, 1798-1857, Ancestry, Fleming County, Kentucky, 1850.
